physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Typical hygonadism with small testes (2 ml), sparse pubic hair (P3), 6 cm penis. Normal sense of smell. Normal pituitary MRI and renal sonography. Low plasma testosterone and serum LH levels, normal serum FSH levels.
Small intrascrotal testes (3 ml), sparse pubic hair (P2), micropenis. Normal sense of smell. Normal pituitary MRI.
Primary amenorrhea, absent breast development, Tanner breast stage 1. Pelvic sonography revealed small ovaries and small uterus. Normal sense of smell, normal MRI.
Complete hypogonadism with small intrascrotal testes (2 ml), sparse pubic hair (P3), and 6 cm penis. Normal sense of smell, normal pituitary MRI.
Very low plasma testosterone and serum LH levels, low to normal serum FSH levels.
After 6 months of combined estrogen-progestin replacement, increased breast development; 3 weeks after, maintained high LH and estradiol levels.
